dialogue.speaker: Young Mother
dialogue.text: I used to meditate. Before... all this. Now I can't find five minutes of quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: What if the chaos is the meditation? What if your toddler is your teacher?

dialogue.speaker: Young Mother
dialogue.text: She certainly teaches me patience. Over and over and over.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: Look at her. Completely present. No past to regret, no future to fear. Just this moment, this stick, this puddle.

dialogue.speaker: Young Mother
dialogue.text: You're right. She's already enlightened, isn't she? I'm the one who forgot.

dialogue.speaker: Toddler
dialogue.text: Look, Mama! The whole world in the water!

actions.action: sits on park bench, watching life unfold with quiet attention
collapses beside him, exhaustion and yearning written in every line
investigates puddle with the focus of a quantum physicist discovering universe
continues its danceâ€”dogs, joggers, clouds, all teaching without words

environment.mood: accessible wisdom, parenthood as spiritual path, teachers everywhere
